content.p: This is my personal homepage at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam where I'm a student Computer Science. My main interests there are theoretical computer science and software technology.
As of september 2005, I'm following the master's program Formal Methods and Software Verification.
From september to december 2005, I'm practicum assistent for the course Inleiding Logica. (I made some notes.)
Also, during spring 2006, I'm practicum assistent for the course Inleiding Theoretische Informatica (Notes for last year.)
Currently I'm mostly interested in logic in computer science and the theory and practice of programming languages (e.g. paradigms, compilers, semantics).
On a less theoretical note, I'm amusing myself playing with LaTeX (the typesetting one that is), the Debian operating system, and small “never-to-finish” programming projects.
I believe in the power of free and open information and software. This includes in particular scientific research. For some online pointers, consult my Links page.

Whenever there's still time left in my day, I try to spend it with my girlfriend Loes, family, or friends. When I'm alone, I try to play some guitar (although Loes is still unimpressed by my playing skills), and listen to music. Some of my favourite bands are Sonic Youth, Mogwai, and my friends Alizarin (best band of The Netherlands).
The main content of my homepage is accessible through the navigation at the bottom of every page. All pages related to my study at university are located in the vu subdirectory.
More info about this website, including the source code, can be found on the colofon page.
If you experience problems reading these pages, please try a decent browser.
